values:
Well, I worked and easy job over the weekend and made some good money.  This will help me for next month when things get tight again.  Who am I kidding?  Things are tight now.  Just because I got a settlement check does NOT mean that that world is fine.  The money only goes so far.  I just have to look at it that I am one house payment ahead so if nothing else works out, at least I have until November before something bad happens with the house.  But, in my gut - somewhere - I know it will work out with the house.  I have to look at the moment and what I am doing to keep it going and not look at what could be.  So far God has provided for me when I least expected it in some way.  Just when I think I am hitting rock bottom I bounce up.  

Last night I had a dream about an old boyfriend and working with him.  It was weird because I have not seen this guy since I was about 19 but he has been on my mind lately for some reason.  Strange.  Maybe if I see him he can give me a job...lol.  

But, the strange thing with this is....I was doing a job on Friday and ran into an old old friend who was my Maid of Honor at my wedding!  Marge and I were best friends when we both mostly had male friends.  We went through a lot with her kids and a pedophile roommate that she had.  It was a bad bad scene but we made it through and became closer.  We had worked together at CT Limo and man oh man did we have some fun.  So, now I have another friend back in my life.  

This morning I have been reading a life makeover book that gives really good information.  It has given me a good place to start and a way to keep track of how I am changing my life.  I have already started to walk more along with doing more yard work so that I can use some muscles that I seem to rarely use.  I have also been looking for an exercise bike to help get a good start.  I did yard work the other day in kind of an unorthodox manner and man oh man, did my legs hurt!!!  But, they hurt in a good way even though it felt awful...lol.   

Also, today is bill day.  I am going to look at what bills I can pay today in order to get those out of the way.  I also vow to actually answer some of the phone calls coming through on my home phone...lol.  

I have to stop kicking myself. I am very very good at kicking myself.  And, it really does not help when others throw in a kick or two either - MOM!  I have to be more positive and change my priorities right now.  I want to straighten out the house and get everything better organized.  Now that I have the third bedroom pretty much cleared out and set - I can move my desk into there to get it back out of the living room.  This will help to make the living area look better and get some clutter OUT.  I need to vacuum my bed - the cat is shedding...lol.  I am tired of being covered in cat hair no matter what I do or where I go.  I have to keep a lint brush in the car.  I don't remember having this issue even when I have 9 cats.  

Ok, time to get off of here and get started making a difference!

Me

Yes, I see a counselor.  I have been seeing her since I was in a very bad accident on I-91 in East Lyme last year.  I was going for an interview, just driving along minding my own business, when it all happened right in front of me.  Truck parts flying everywhere hitting my NEW car and then watching the tanker jump the guardrail and the driver plus two others die in front of me.  One of them I had talked to on the phone as she had worked for the credit union I have my car loan through.  I never ever ever want to go through that again - I don't think I would survive seeing all of that again.  The police officers kept insisting I go to the hospital due to shock and I refused.  I actually had to sign a AMA form at the accident scene for the paramedics.  Some days I think I should have gone.  

Thank God Janice was living with me at that time.  She was able to pick Jonathan up from school and keep him from watching tv.  Of course, it didnt help that one of his friends called and told him they saw me on tv...lol.  Kids - gotta love em.  

Anyway, lately I have been going through a tough time.  I can't sleep, I am eating all wrong, trying to lose weight, get the house finally settled, and doing it all in pain.  My back and neck hurt worse than you can imagine and there is little I can do now without alot of pain.  But, I was only given so much money from workers comp this past month and I think that is it until I get my settlement from the lady that caused the injury in a car accident.  So, I try to do the yardwork a little at a time along with housework - which sucks...lol.  

I have been given the assignment of writing this to help figure out what I want.  I have told her that I dont know what I want to do for work - I am pretty happy doing the mystery shopping and yet that will not pay the mortgage.  I want to feel better - both mentally and physically.  Some days I forget so many things it is scary.  Physically (like today) I am in so much pain it is hard to walk - although some of that is because I took ANOTHER dive in the front yard the other day.  No, I dont think anyone saw me go down...lol.  But, as for work, I have no ambition, no drive, no goals except that it has to pay me over 50K a year.  

Hmmm, I am getting so tired maybe I can sleep.  Long day tomorrow as I have patron counts to do on Saturday and Sunday.  Woohooo....I get to see the movie Wanted all by myself - 8 times!!!  HAHAHAHAHA  Gotta love it.

More later!

P

Yeah, it has been months since I last posted.  And, a lot has happened.  Too much in some ways.  Not enough in others.  Kind of a contradiction huh?  lol

I have also come to a conclusion.  Those that cry hardest at a tender moment in a movie or a touching moment where most are not crying are the ones that are hurting the most.  Those that are the loneliest.  My observation is all I guess.

Now, for the catch up.  I bought my house.  Three bedrooms, 1 1/2 baths, a full basement and hard wood floors...ahhhhh.  Oh yeah, and no nosy neighbors yet!!  All of my neighbors seem really really nice and I feel very lucky.  Instead of the train I hear the tree frogs, birds, and crickets. 

My step dad and Uncle Ronny are going to be doing some of the remodeling.  I think they feel bad.  I got my new roof and have my contractor Eric.  I love Eric - he is a complete Italian...lol.  He is so hot and has a loud mouth.  But, you can see he loves his kids and he has helped me out above and beyond.  He is even going to be my date for my sisters wedding!  Yay!  That was just finalized today and I only asked once.  Since we spent some time together over the weekend, I guess it was ok.  

Anyway, I guess this is just a very small piece and I am tired.  Another long day in the Bronx tomorrow.  Wish me luck...lol.

Me

Hello world...lol.  Well, it has been an interesting week so far.  Not a good week - but an interesting one.  And, it could have been worse.  As some of you know, I was in the hospital Monday and Tuesday.  Here is the story.

Monday I was driving to Stamford for work - it wasn't a difficult drive though there was traffic on the Merritt as usual.  Once I got off the parkway, I took some back roads through Stamford.  When I was in the center of town and stopped at a light, all of a sudden I felt very dizzy and light headed.  I closed my eyes and thought, oh no, pleeeeease, I am only 3 blocks from the store.  I thought I was going to throw up.  This lasted only a minute or two and felt better by the time the light changed.  For some reason, this didn't disturb me...strange.  Once I got into the parking garage - it became a totally different scene.  

I parked and sat for a minute because the dizziness was back.  As I sat there, I put my hand to my face, leaned my head back a little and felt really crappy.  I think I was pulling the keys out of the ignition when I passed out.  It was only a minute or so that I was out.  I came to and I called Musco because my movements were really slow and I couldn't think clearly.  When I tried to talk to him, it was like remedial speech - very slow and I couldn't articulate what I was thinking.  I thought I had a stroke so I was starting to get upset.  He told me to sit there, drink some water, and see if it would pass.  I hung up from him and called the owner of the store I was going to.  I told her where I was in the parking garage (of course in an empty part) and she sent someone out with some water.  

At this point, I still couldn't speak clearly and my coordination was still off on my right side mainly.  I tried to stand up and walk and I was staggering like I was drunk and couldn't walk a straight line.  They made me sit back down and called security and the paramedics because it was now about 20 minutes since it had happened and I still was out of it.  

Here come the firefighters and the paramedics.  Great.  Wonderful.  How friggin embarassing.  They all agreed that I needed to get to the ER.  Great, make my day.  So, I handed my keys to the GM of the store stumbled over to the gurney and away we go.  Thru the mall.  Thru another garage and then down part of the sidewalk.  Did I mention this was slightly embarassing?  All the while I was dizzy and thought I was going to throw up so I kept my eyes closed.  

So, into the ER I go.  Everyone was super nice and very helpful.  My speech was finally coming back but I was still a little dizzy and lightheaded.  My BP was very high for me.  Then they try to get the IV in and all of my veins were collapsed - wonderful.  She finally got a vein in my arm after I direct her to the easiest place they usually stick me told her to tie on the tournaquet REAL tight and it should hold.  It did finally but it wasn't easy so there was blood everywhere.  

Then the tests start - X-Rays, CAT scan, blood work, constant monitoring of vitals, EEG (this ruined a perfectly good hair day...lol), and an echo cardiogram.  We tried the MRI machine but there was something wrong with it and you couldn't touch the inside of the machine when you were inside because it would get hot. And, well, I had no way NOT to touch the inside.  So, now I have to go for that next week some time.

Final diagnosis, who knows? I have to go back to the doctor today for a follow up before I feel comfortable driving too far.  Then, get the other testing done that they wanted.  But, my heart is fine so they think it could be neurological.  The MRI will rule out an aneurysm or a clot on the brain...yes, the EEG showed I have one...lol.  So, I am still scared a little though I keep saying to myself that it could just be vertigo gone wild.  It just has to be something correctable because I have Jonathan - failure is not an option.  

I will have more later on - some funny things that happened and also some very touching things.  

See ya later!

Phyllis

As everyone knows, the work for my job runs by the calendar month for the most part.  So, the end of the month is usually stressful.  I like to have two free days at the end of the month. This month my schedule with evals leaves me one day - but, I think I have to go to Peekskill again...sigh.  I could just kick that owner.  

We are taking over the store which mean ALL of us will be taking turns going out there now.  I hope we can find another buyer soon.  It is just too far to be able to manage properly.  

Anyway, tonight I have to go to a meeting in Ft. Lee, NJ which is just over the George Washington Bridge.  I have never driven that way by myself.  So, this should be interesting.  Jonathan is staying overnight at moms because I probably won't be home until midnight.  Then, tomorrow I am slated to go to Peekskill I think - which means leaving here by 6:30am to get there early to do the inventory and close out the old owners business.  I am hoping now that I sent Musco my schedule he will cancel me going out there.  

This weekend was work work work in Manhattan - and even when sleeping i can't escape.  Most of my dreams the last few nights have been about some aspect of work.  And, so far here, all I have done is talk work!  It sucks...lol.

Well, the condo is looking great with the new paint and the new blinds.  The hosue hunting has not been going all that good.  Not like I have time to look for a house anyway.  And, well, if I buy it house, it will need to be near some single guy who will cut my lawn - yes, I have one in mind - lol.  But, the house near him is a little on the expensive side.  Cute neighborhood for sure - and the house is 3bd 2ba which is what I have been looking for.  Oh well, it will work out when it is supposed to.

Overall, I have been in a great frame of mind - I am out from under a whole bunch of shit.  Between getting the condo more organized, painted, the new blinds up, and getting rid of 270 lbs of idiot, I can breathe easier.  A lot easier.  Plus I banked a lot of money this month thanks to bonuses and it all went into savings.  So, if I can keep this up for several months, I will also be able to rest easier on being able to afford a larger mortgage.  Also, we will be able to go on a kick butt vacation...lol...not that I have time...hmmm.

So, even though it has been crazy, it has been good.  Getting a lot of stuff done and am feeling much healthier over all.

May you have an excellent day!

Me

Wow, been a crazy week!  The excitement never stops...lol.  It seems like I haven't had any time to relax - except for this past Saturday when I was not feeling well and pretty much slept for most of the day.  

Work has been crazy - I talked to Musco yesterday and we swear that there has been a full moon out every night because of the crazy stuff going on.  We finally "sold"  Peekskill only to have the owner back out at the last minute AFTER we got the store open because he thinks it is too much work.  Well, of course it is, it is your business.  Once you get things settled with staff THEN you get time off.  Until then, you need to actually train the people.  Incredible. So, now we have been scrambling the last two days to find someone to buy it or run it.  

Then yesterday I am in another store doing the eval and a customer comes in to tell the owner what had happened the previous night in the store.  One of the employees had threatened him with a knife (in front of witnesses) and told him to get the f*** out of the store.  Alrighty then.  The employee quit immediately after this happened - which was a good thing because the customer had come back with a baseball bat to kick his ass.   Classy, very classy.  The customer said he thought the kid was on drugs.  Well, this guy doesn't do drugs, drink, or smoke.  He has diabetes which has been acting up and can cause wild mood swings when not controlled.  So, that was the drama for yesterday.  I just wanted to go home and here I have to deal with this...lol.

Speaking of drama - the drama has ended - YAY!  I have said my piece and it has ended all the drama of the 2 1/2 yrs.   Funny how the truth can clear the air and give you back your sanity (or what is left of it...lol).  I think all of my friends are jumping for joy at what has transpired.  All have said, it's about time, I deserve better.  Which boy oh boy, do I.  And, I may just have found it!  When you let go of crap - it makes room for the good. I don't need someone with crappy morals who lies constantly to everyone in my life. I have redone my buddy list and opened back up for everyone to see because I don't have to hide myself from anyone anymore - because I don't care!!

Bill #1 from last year keeps calling.  We have not gotten together because I don't want to get together.  As friends, we are good.  I am not interested in anything else with him at all.  But, well, the person who is going to hang my blinds, he is an excellent choice I think.  And, he is coming over tomorrow to finally hang them!!  Yay!!

The house hunt - continues sloooowwwwwly.  We have determined that my condo will not go down in price like a regular home would.  With Waylands help, I am doing up a budget and doing some more saving.  I have already paid off several bills and once the income tax check gets here, two more are going.  So, all in all, it will open up another 200 a month to save.  And save I am going to do!  We set up a plan yesterday that will not only make SURE I can and want to afford a much larger mortgage but will also help me save more towards a downpayment.  So, here I sit waiting for the right thing to come along.  In the meantime, I have finished most of the painting and have been looking at a few other things to deal with living here.  

Well, it is 7:05am and I need to go get ready.  Oh, for those who don't know already - I am back to a brunette color - though there is a little blonde showing thru.  And, it looks awesome!  I have gotten so many compiments on it.  I would have done it years ago if I had not been living to "please" someone.  Yuck.  If I ever do taht again, just kick me in the ass will you my friends??  lol  And, well, right a response will ya???  LOL

I love you guys!!

Me

I found a house that no one seems to want me to buy - except maybe Wayland and Rich.  My poor real estate agent is caught between me and my mom.  I love the house. I could even peek my head into the attic and be ok with it - of course Wayland and Rich were up there already.  

I know the house is too close to the road, but, well, who cares?  It has survived this long right?  And we would just be using the back door anyway.  I love the backyard.  And, I love the deck...and no neighbors close by!!  Of course, there is lawn to cut...lol.  

And, Wayland...ahhh Wayland.  What to think there?  I want him...in a way...not sure how...lol.  And Peter, now, I want him in a way too.  I think there is something wrong with me..I dont really want any man right now.  They will interrupt my schedule...lol.

Well, I did it.  I "outed" Dennis and I on my myspace.  I can only hope he will understand.  We discussed it about 2 weeks ago and well, I know those six days are going to last forever, or at least until all the tracks are covered.  So, I did it tonight.  Does it possibly have something to do with me PMSing a bit?  I am sure it might in some ways.  But, I think it is more about self respect and truth.  And, the truth will set you free - that is what they say.  

Will he ever talk to me again?  Maybe, maybe not.  If he is a man, it will all be good.  If not, then, well, what can I say?  There are plenty of men out there and I will just have to be more available to let one find me.  Because, lets face it - I haven't been available to anyone else in two years.  Not all the way.   Not ever.  And, I probably will not be for a long time.  

I have so much other stuff on my plate.  Telling the truth was just one more thing off the list.  And, I AM sorry for the grief it may cause. I honestly, truly am. But, that will pass.  And, there will be no more lies to have to tell - no more bullshit.   I am taking myspace off within the next few days.  I am WAY too old to be on there and don't use it for any info besides the show info. And, that I can get from my sister.  

So, my apologies for the grief you are about to encounter.  You are a strong man and will get through it.  

Ok, it is late...I need sleeeeep.

Me

Yeah, did my taxes yesterday and I am getting back $3300 total.  That will pay off my furniture and will allow me to stay ahead.  We may even have a vacation again this year.  Or, it may go towards the house.  All I know is, at least one more bill will be gone.  I may pay off some of my credit cards and give them to mom to hang onto so I can't use them..lol.

After doing the taxes we went to look at a house.  The price was way too high, especially with that kitchen!  OMG  Fixures from the 50's and a kitchen straight from the 70'2.  All dark with the scalloped trim over the soffit.  Now, yes, this could all be redone - but, with what they are asking, there would be no money to be made off of doing these improvements.  There is paneling through most of the house that the contractor is painting white.  The living room was nice though an odd shape, the three bedrooms all were in good shape and of decent size.  The master bedroom had its own bath!!!  The sunroom was nice too with the exception of the face brick on the walls.  Anyway, that is a wash but it was nice to see it because now I won't fantasize about it anymore - oh, and it still had the old people smell to it - odd.  

So, today I am going to look at two more.  One is almost identical to one that I put a bid on last year and lost.  The other has been totally redone and I think is about 70 feet from the entrance to Yalesville School on one side and about 100 feet from the front entrance to a Subway store...lol.  Man, if I get that, Dave Balch will be pissed cuz I would just be too close.  But, of all, that house is priced the lowest and is really the cutest.  The pics online look really good and the house is 1400 sq ft.  So, there are a lot of plusses.

My computer has been acting up, I think I have just left it on too long...I don't think it has been off in two weeks.  Of course, it is acting up because I just paid it off and the one year warranty is going to be up later this month...lol.

I never did get to painting yesterday.  Too busy running around going crazy all day.  I also got ALL the papers off of the dining rom table FINALLY.  What an awesome feeling.  Everything where it belongs...yesa.  So, today is painting day.  I hope I can move the tv table I have...it is more of a side table/buffet table thing and is fairly heavy.  Also, this is going to go onto the wall with the windows again.  I like where the tv is now but there is really no way to maneuver the furniture the way I want it where the tv is now.  So, back it goes!  Now, to figure out what pictures/art I am going to hang on the wall...hmmmmm.  

So, that is the day...looking at houses, painting, and deciding if I should put my condo on the market.  Yes, I am afraid - I have to do this all on my own.  If I make a mistake, it is my financial future at stake.  It would be so much easier in many ways to stay here.  I can save money (when I am not on workers comp) and not have to worry.  If I had been in a house when I was on workers comp, I most likely would have either lost it, or would have gotten behind in some bills and ruined the credit I have worked to build.  But, I want this and I have to overcome my fear.  I was strong enough to leave Florida to make it better and I am strong enough to do this.  

When I was having my taxes done yesterday, Gene (the tax man) was saying how far I have come since he first met me.  I had almost no furniture, was living in a little rented condo that I absolutely hated, driving my poor little Toyota Tercel the looked ok but was not quite running all that great (though it never broke down), and I was working as a receptionist for the school system that was boooorrrrrring!   Now, I own my own place, my credit is MUCH better, I have furniture, and I don't have to worry about clothing or feeding my son.  Oh yeah, and I put away a good amount in my IRA last year.  I need to be proud of what I have accomplished.  Wayland always tells me that too.  

Oh, and the "fixer upper" house?  OMG  Mold on the outside of the house, the wood is rotting on the outside, it needs new windows and all new siding on the outside.  But, it is across the street from the park, in a good neighborhood, and has a lot of potential.  I think I would still buy it - along with a LOT of bleach...lol.

So, now to start the day.  Going to take a shower early (now) and get moving.  Lots to do! 

Hope you all have a great day!

Me

There are days when I question who I am.  Not what I stand for but what I do, say, and am.  Some days I feel like the dumbest bunny on the planet.  Like today.  How many times can I be insulted?  

First the boss.  Nothing like talking about the results of the "popularity" poll taken with the owners and saying he thought I scored the lowest...sigh.  Which really, the score is not low.  The highest it goes is five and I got a 4.3.  He said out average was either a 4.3 or 4.5...if the average is 4.3 how can I be the lowest???  Anyway, nothing like being made to feel like crap in front of the other staff who all looked mortified.  I talked to Mel about it and she said the only reason I scored lower - if I did - is because I actually do the job right and hold the owners to a higher standard. For some reason, that did not make me feel much better - a little but not much.

Now, funny enough...during the meeting we were tossing around ideas and issues that were coming up and I was coming up with my ideas for solutions (weird, most of the other staff rarely have anything to contribute) and JP was like, man, Philly, you are right on target today woohoo, look at you go.  Yeah, ok JOhn, calm down...like I don't have ideas on other days?  Who was the one who coordinated operation computers the other day for the Bronx? It wouldnt have gotten done at all if not for me.  I am feeling very under valued.

Then comes lunch...talking about Pauls stats being too high after his physical like BP, cholesterol and everything and everyone is kind of chatting about it.  I said, wow, my doc said I was the healthiest person (if not the clumsiest) in his practice because my bp is always 110/70 and my cholesterol was 174 and all of my numbers are all within range.  He says, wow, I never would have thought that in a person your size, that is excellent.  Now, ok, thank you for thinking that is excellent but well, just because I am a person "of size" (and exactly how big am I, hmmm?????) doens't mean we have to be unhealthy.  I climb on the counters, move normally, and do almost everything else anyone else can do.  I move faster than David does.  

Then Dan says, oh, what Mall did you see that doctor in?  You have to be kidding me.  Bill says, no, what vet was that huh?  What vet did you see??  I was like OMG...I think I just had a stunned look on my face and didn't say anything.  I didn't know quite what to say.  But, if I hadn't been blocked into my seat by Musco, I would have gotten up and left.  It was embarassing and uncalled for.

So, went back to the office and try to talk to Musco on the way back about gicing the staff regular evaluations for performance and regular feedback.  And, either he was not listening or was playing stupid ( I think more not listening) and started talking about the audit on the evals and how he wished we didn't have to do them.  I was like, hello, I was talking about evaluating US and giving feedback.  Most normal companies have some sort of system set up for a review - not this one.  You fly by the seat of your pants until you really fuck up.  

At the office I set up the computer for Peekskill.  I can't wait to go back there and yet, I don't want to go back there.  I looked up the convent to see what was going on there and they are making the actual convent into 12 multi-level condos.  I signed up for the waiting list for information when they have more like floor plans and such.  They are also going to do 125 other homes/condos on the upper property around the convent in the same stone and architectural style.  I want to live there.  In another time and another place.  Only because in this life, it just wouldn't make sense - I don't know if that makes sense.  I think what I love about there is all going to change and that saddens me.  The one place in this world where I feel I truly belong and I have loved with all my heart since I have seen it - and a developer is going to change it.  What are they going to do with the cemetary?  And the nasty dirty fish pond that used to be beautiful?  We shall see.

I found a house.  I want it.  It is a "diamond in the rough" as Dennis says.  It was built in the 70's and has electric heat!!  Of course, all the old stuff is still there and stuff needs replacing.  And, there has been some neglect.  I may try to talk to the real estate agent again tomorrow.  We are supposed to look at another house that I KNOW I am not going to buy, it just is too much money for me on my own.  

Anyway, I was talking to Dennis about the house thing and he says - you are only going to look til you get tired of it and you will end up staying right where you are.  Well, no I won't, not if I don't have to.  I refuse to stay stuck here.  I want a house - am I scared?  YES!  It is a lot of responsibility and I can only hope that I make the right decision.  Not to mention financial wise.  He called it a welfare hotel once - why would I want to stay here if that is the way people perceive it?  I feel like I have to apologize for living here all the time.

So, yes, I know I am PMSing to a point...and, even after all the crap, I haven't cried or anything.  I think I am kind of numb.  Numb can be good - you don't feel much of anything.  It is better than feeling too much.  

Well, now I don't feel like writing anymore...lol.

Tomorrow will be better - I get to do my taxes...lol.

Night!

Me

You know when a Monday really starts off...bad?  And then proceeds to get worse and just never gets back on track.  Not that the day is a total loss but it just seems, off?  And you wish that you could just go back and redo.  Some days I really wish if I yelled REDO it would work.  

The PPT went fairly well.  Jonathan is moving ahead and I am rethinking the whole Sylvan thing.  I may just try working with him more at home...sigh, I hate this.  Does anyone else ever wonder if they are screwing up their kid?  lol  We changed the main teacher for his TLC reading and Jonathan got excited when I told him.  So, I think that will motivate him some more also.

Dennis...ahhh, men.  Do men understand us?  Do we understand them??  The simple answer - NO.   But, at least we worked out some issues.

Work...the first store I went to was full of issues. Way too full...tuna 7 days old.  Yuck.  The second store was a joy to be at.  The people there are sooooo nice.  Very friendly and great to talk to.  I really love them.  They are good people.

After work...seemed like nonstop.  Pick up J, came home and ate, did homework, reading, four (yeah four)loads of laundry, emails, the bathroom (yeah, stomach still not quite right), and general stuff.  So, absolutely NOTHING exciting in a good way today.  How crappy is that???  LOL

Ok, so I am not in the best of moods today. Like I told Mel, I took a Xanax before I went to the PPT and I don't think it worked....either that or I was REALLY bad off and the Xanax just brought it down to mildly bad.  It is the first Xanax in months...I am not even sure it worked...I need to check the expiration date...lol.

Anyway, now I am hanging out in chat with the man and doing a Sudoku puzzle...I am hooked.  So, have a good night and may tomorrow be a great day for all.

Me

Do you ever wonder why you feel the way you do?

Do you ever wonder how in the hell you got where you are?

What forms us?  Who we are.

First, let me explain that my mother says I "think too much" and at times I agree.  It is NOT something that I am very proud of.  And, I try to "think" less.  One thing that I have always been adamant about is a "title".  I always need to know where I stand - at work, at home, in a relationship.  And, I don't know why because it is really not that important and it is much easier without one.  There are titles that we can not escape once we are in them such as daughter, mother, sister, relative among others.  

There are others in which others place us or we place ourselves.  In school, for the most part for me it was "fat girl".  Which was traumatizing for a long time, and some days it still is (like when you can't fit into your "fat jeans"  lol).  Then it was "star" at work because I give 200% to work usually.  (hmmm, had to stop and watch Grey's Anatomy and laugh...lol). Yeah, I am short attention span gal now...lol.  

Anyway, I look at how some titles have affected my life.  And, how, as an adult, it is high time I change the outcome of some of them.  The main title I had when I was little was "Daddy's Girl".  That has not been in play for a very long time. And, well, I am so mad at him for treating me like shit.  I have surpassed feeling bad and am now ANGRY.  He has not only left me in the dirt, but his other three kids also.  And, they were younger when it happened.  Of course, they had a step father who loved them very much to the best of my knowledge - I have one that I constantly bump heads with...lol. When I think of all the times he called me fat, ugly, stupid and told me I would amount to nothing - well, fuck him.  Just because you are a parent - it does not give you the right to torture your child.  

As I look back on how he has influenced the way I think about myself, I could really cry.  The low self esteem during my teens and early twenties was the worst.  I married a man because I thought for sure that no one else would ever ever love me.  Then to find out he was gay and an alcoholic to boot - well, HELLO!  But, I grew from that experience.  For a long time I was the main support and I got through a lot of tough situations that no one should ever have to go through.  And, when you are trying to be the best you can be and someone is just holding you down - that is the worst part.  I work hard to get ahead - no one will ever drag me down again.

I was meant for more - more what I am not sure.  I guess I have looked back with regret the last few days.  Too many wrong paths taken - too many consequences.  I guess we learn from our mistakes but, well, that just sucks.  Don't get me wrong - all is not horrible and I am not in a depressive state.  I know it could be MUCH worse.  I could be on assistance or be living with someone in a horrible relationship.  My son could have worse issues than he does.  I KNOW it could be worse.  But, I just want it to be better.

But, what will that take?  I am not really happy with where I live but it is ok for now...and I have furniture, credit cards, and extras that many families do without.  (Of course I have the bills to go with them..lol).  The relationsip front is kinda strange right now.  But, not having a "label" is good.  And, well, Bill...I feel bad for him but it is just not right.  I have a good time with Den and that is how I like it.  

Ahhh, the elusive sleep again.  Of course, I knew that drinking soda would NOT help the sleep situation...lol.  At least I have cable...lol.  

Well, enough of this...and off to sleepyland.  Thanks for listening to me vent - if anyone is still reading this - it seems like forever since I really wrote anything here.
